trans-unit.source: Except for creatures named Akron Legionnaire and artifact creatures, creatures you control can't attack.
Choose one — Target player gains X life; or prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."\n—D'Avenant proverb
Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·4 | Call to Arms | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Call to Arms
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME3·4 | Call to Arms | Card Text
trans-unit.source: As Call to Arms enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent. White creatures get +1/+1. When the chosen color isn't the most common color among permanents the chosen player controls, sacrifice Call to Arms.
Cleanse
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Destroy all black creatures.
The clouds broke and the sun's rays burst forth; each foul beast in its turn faltered, and was gone.
{T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Divine Intervention
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Divine Intervention enters the battlefield with two intervention counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an intervention counter from Divine Intervention. If there are no intervention counters on it, the game is a draw.
Cast Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player. Destroy target attacking creature.
Exorcist
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.
Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
"All warfare is based on deception."\n—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

trans-unit.resname: ME3·12 | Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Horsemanship When Guan Yu is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·13 | Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Destroy all tapped creatures.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·13 | Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse;/ With dragon blade he took each pass by force."
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."\n—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest
Protection from red Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a red permanent.
The elite guard of the Mesa High Priests, the Ivory Guardians, were created to protect the innocent and faithful. Some say their actions are above the law.
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
"Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—Had never been, nor ever was again."

At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
Lightning Blow
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
"If you do it right, they'll never know what hit them."\n—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

trans-unit.resname: ME3·19 | Liu Bei, Lord of Shu | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Horsemanship Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·19 | Liu Bei, Lord of Shu | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."\n—Liu Bei
Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·22 | Peach Garden Oath | Card Text
trans-unit.source: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·22 | Peach Garden Oath | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood. . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."\n—Peach Garden Oath
Horsemanship
In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·24 | Shu Elite Companions | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Horsemanship

trans-unit.resname: ME3·24 | Shu Elite Companions | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."
Horsemanship, vigilance
When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·27 | Wall of Light | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Wall of Light

trans-unit.resname: ME3·27 | Wall of Light | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: As many attackers were dazzled by the wall's beauty as were halted by its force.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·28 | Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Horsemanship, vigilance

trans-unit.resname: ME3·28 | Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce to your mana pool.
The rising oceans brought new lakes—and new terrors—to Terisiare. The Explorers found their ancient enemies spawning everywhere.
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."\n—William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second
Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.
Draw three cards.
At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

trans-unit.resname: ME3·33 | Capture of Jingzhou | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Take an extra turn after this one.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·33 | Capture of Jingzhou | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·34 | Dance of Many | Card Text
trans-unit.source: When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target nontoken creature. When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the creature token. When the creature token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many. At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

trans-unit.source: Untap target artifact, creature, or land. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then again, we minotaurs are stubborn beings."\n—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

trans-unit.source: Horsemanship

trans-unit.resname: ME3·41 | Lu Meng, Wu General | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

trans-unit.source: When you cast Mana Vortex, you may sacrifice a land. If you don't, counter Mana Vortex. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land. When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.
Counter target creature spell.

trans-unit.source: Horsemanship

trans-unit.resname: ME3·54 | Wu Elite Cavalry | Flavor Text

Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

trans-unit.resname: ME3·58 | Ashes to Ashes | Card Text

Takklemaggot
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Enchant creature At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature. When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, that creature's controller chooses a creature that Takklemaggot could enchant. If he or she does, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control attached to that creature. If he or she doesn't, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control as a non-Aura enchantment. It loses "enchant creature" and gains "At the beginning of that player's upkeep, Takklemaggot deals 1 damage to him or her."

trans-unit.source: {T}: Choose two target blocking creatures an opponent controls. If each of those creatures could block all creatures that the other is blocking, remove both of them from combat. Each one then blocks all creatures the other was blocking. Whenever Sorrow's Path becomes tapped, it deals 2 damage to you and each creature you control.

"Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down."\n—Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"
